original: Holmberg, Carl Olof, musikdirektör, Göteborg, f. 11/7/71 i Mjällby, Blek. 1., av folkskilär. Bengt H. o. Maria Remmelin. G. 03 m. Esther Lundéii. Barn: Bengt f. 04, fil. dr, Upps., Elsie 07, lär., Gbg, Margit 12, konstn., Gbg. — Organistex. i Växjö 88, folksk:lär:-ex. i Lund 92, musiklär:-, kyrkosång:- 0. organistex. v. musikkons. 03, röst-fysiol. stud. m. m. i Jena 11. Lär. v. Gbgs folksk. 92-13, musik- o. sånglär. v. Gbgs folksk :sem. 12-33. Organist i Betlehemskyrkan 98-09, i S :t Johannes kyrka 14-41. Ordn. instrukt :kurs i skolsång o. talteknik v. Nääs sem. 10, på uppdr. av Sv:es allm. folksk :-lär :fören. o. skolöverstyr. fortsatt o. ’förltagt kurser t. alda deikr av Sv :e, håll. kurser f. provårskand. v. samtl. provårslärov. i Gbg, sakk. bitr. i musik i skolöverstyr. f. uppgör, av und:-visn:plan f. folksk :sem. o. folksk. samt i skolkomm. f. ordn. av musik-und :visn. f. allm. lärov., flicksk. o. ly-céer, sakk. i sem:komm., fd. v. ordf. i Sv:es sem:fören., ordf. i Nord. sånglär :fören. m. m., fd. led. av kyrko-fullm., kyrkoråd o. tax:nd, fd. ordf. i Bö komm:fören. Skr.: sångpedagog, arb. o. sångböcker, komp. RVO, Litt. et Art.
translated: Holmberg, Carl Olof, music director, Gothenburg, born July 11, 1871 in Mjällby, Blekinge, the first child of Bengt H. and Maria Remmelin, who were school teachers. Married in 1903 to Esther Lundéii. Children: Bengt, born in 1904, a PhD student in Uppsala, Elsie born in 1907, a teacher in Gothenburg, Margit born in 1912, an artist in Gothenburg. Holmberg passed his organ exam in Växjö in 1888, then passed his teacher exam at Lund University in 1892. He also passed his music teacher, choir singing, and organ exams at the music conservatory in 1903, and studied voice physiology in Jena in 1911. He was a teacher at Gothenburg primary schools from 1892 to 1913, a music and singing teacher at the Gothenburg primary school seminary from 1912 to 1933. He was an organist at Betlehemskyrkan from 1898 to 1909, and at S:t Johannes kyrka from 1914 to 1941. Holmberg organized instructional courses in school singing and speech at Nääs seminary in 1910. He was appointed by the Swedish public school teachers' association and school authorities for continuing courses given to Swedish teachers. He held courses for graduating students at all high schools in Gothenburg and was a consultant in music for the school authorities in preparing teaching plans for primary schools and seminaries. He was also a consultant for the school committees in organizing music education for high schools, girl schools, and lyceums. Holmberg was a consultant for seminaries and former chairman of the Swedish seminary association, chairman of the Nordic choral singing association, and former member of the church council and tax council. He was also a former chairman of Bö komm:fören. He authored books on singing, pedagogy, and music composition. Holmberg was awarded the RVO and was recognized for his literary and artistic contributions.

structured.name: Carl Olof Holmberg
structured.description: Carl Olof Holmberg was a music director from Gothenburg, Sweden.

award.name: Knight of the Order of Vasa
